data.text: @katgordon @TheAcecapade The industry trends seem to be steering that way - strategists do the thinking & creatives execute. Way before strategists focussed on creative strategy, they focussed on business dev. Creatives/Designers are thinkers not artworkers, I understand this is a market ≠ between UK/US
@and_says_ @TheAcecapade It's not an idea -- it's an INSIGHT. Strategists identify an opportunity for the brand + the creative team brings it to life.
@TheAcecapade @katgordon It’s really weird - it’s so easy to forget other markets inner workings! ;)
@and_says_ @katgordon Ahhhh haha. Yeah, I can see why that is, and as an ex-CW I so see where you're coming from haha.

@TheAcecapade @katgordon Been thinking about where the disconnect was & then I remembered a recent conversation where I learned things work differently stateside (strategy is credited with ideation - which is weird). In the UK, creatives and designers come up with ideas not strategists.
@and_says_ @katgordon We'll have to watch this campaign play out to see who to credit, but why not?

@TheAcecapade @katgordon Agreed - it’s a timely, informed, poignant, relevant, intentional, values-led campaign. It’s a very good piece of work.

But (possibly) crediting ideas down to strategy?

@and_says_ @katgordon I don't think it's sarcasm — she has a point. Yes, Nike has a history making bold pro-athlete statements, but the Kaepernick piece stands out because the copy confirms the big risk player and brand have taken for such a small action.

Great copy, great context and insight.

It's not a fluke that any of those athletes were chosen. Definitely makes the signing of Shaquem Griffin mean so much more by giving him the same treatment as Odell, Serena and Colin. 

Big for National Champion @UCF_Football, too.
It's the insight here that's something that we may hope to see in the coming months. Today's athlete stands for something more, and in order to keep them, Nike needs to stand with them too.
@katgordon I was getting to that haha
@TheAcecapade It’s whoever had the idea that deserves credit. Possibly a strategist.
